Posts.Content: katehudson25 wrote: I have idc, and my tumor size is 4mm. Histologic grade is well differentiated. Grade is 1. I have a positive medial-posterior margin and dcis within 5 mm of anterior margin. I need re-excision surgery and a snb. I am worried about getting clear margins with the re-excision surgery. I would like to hear from someone who had a positive medial-posterior margin and clear margins with the second surgery. Does anyone know the % that I will get clear margins with the re-excision surgery?  I was just diagnosed on Thursday, so please be understanding about me being so worrisome. Thank you. Posts.Content: katehudson25 wrote: I had a lumpectomy last Friday and received the pathology report today. I have infiltrating ductal carcinoma, well differentiated, 0.4 cm. Pathology report also says associated major component of dcis low to intermediate nuclear grade.It also says invasive and insitu carcinoma is present at the mediall-posteropr margin. Dcis is also present within 5 mm of anterior margin. My doctor has recommended excisional surgery and a sentinel lymph node biopsy. My doctor said 0.4cm is a tiny tiny tumor. Does anyone know if that is true? She said because it is so small there is only a 1% chance it is in my lymph nodes. Does anyone know if that is true. Also the low to intermediate nuclear grade does that mean how fast it is spreading? Also does anyone know the liklihood that I will have clean margins in the second surgery? I would appreciate all the support that I can get. My breast looks ok now, but I am worried about how my breast will look after the second surgery. Has anyone had this second surgery and not needed breast reconstrution. My breast are fairly small.
